Interface PoolSimulator

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    SimplePoolSimulator
    public interface PoolSimulator
    This interface represents a pool simulator. It is used to simulate the motion of a ball on a pool table.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void advance()
      Advances the simulation by one unit of time.
      double getBallPositionX()
      Returns the x-coordinate of the center of the ball.
      double getBallPositionY()
      Returns the y-coordinate of the center of the ball.
      double getBallRadius()
      Returns the radius of the ball.
      double getBallVelocityX()
      Returns the x-component of the velocity of the ball.
      double getBallVelocityY()
      Returns the y-component of the velocity of the ball.
      java.lang.String getStatus()
      Returns the status of the simulation.
      int getTableHeight()
      Returns the height of the table.
      int getTableWidth()
      Returns the width of the table.
      void start​(int x, int y, int radius, int speed, double dx, double dy)
      Starts the simulation with a ball at the given position, radius, and velocity.

    • Method Detail

      • start

        void start​(int x,
           int y,
           int radius,
           int speed,
           double dx,
           double dy)
    throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Starts the simulation with a ball at the given position, radius, and velocity.
        Parameters:
        x - The x-coordinate of the initial position of the ball.
        y - The y-coordinate of the initial position of the ball.
        radius - The radius of the ball.
        speed - The magnitude of the initial velocity of the ball.
        dx - The x-component of the direction vector of the ball's velocity.
        dy - The y-component of the direction vector of the ball's velocity.
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - If any of the parameters are invalid.
